Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fedidas
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, really nice neighborhood. Rooms are extremely small but very quiet and the bed is really comfortable. Staff is kind. I have no complains. It's not cheap, but you won't find anything cheaper in the same location. Breakfast is not included, there is no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: herbsandspices
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. As others have pointed out, there is not much space in the rooms. The "wardrobe" space in the superior room does not have doors, and on both occasions I was there, there was a bit of dust along the wall, which flew around as I hung my clothes. Otherwise, I found the place to be clean and pleasant looking. I wish the blackout curtain had been much longer, though. Light was bursting in from underneath it. However, the bed was very comfortable. Overall, I felt that the room served me well. On one of those occasions, a signal no. 10 typhoon (the strongest) hit Hong Kong in the night, but I was blissfully unaware of that in the hotel room. The next day, I found out that some Hongkongers had been unable to sleep that night from the noise of the heavy downpour, so I counted myself lucky! This is of course a rare event. Yes, some of the staff are not so polished. After I had checked out, I came back to collect my luggage and requested to use the bathroom. The one I spoke to showed all kinds of exasperation on his face and was not exactly handling it smoothly--until we clarified that I wanted to use a toilet. Other encounters with the staff went well, so I'm quite happy on this front.

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonable staff and lack of space”
Reviews.Author: JCPY
Reviews.Content: 1. Pushy and unreasonable staff: my husband had to leave his luggage at Sohotel at about 9am because his flight arrived in HK early. I arrived later at 11am because I took a different flight. At 9am, the reservation staff at Sohotel insisted that my husband paid for the room deposit with his credit card and another $300 in cash for a separate deposit. My husband requested for the staff to take the deposit from me later at 11am. But the staff declined and insisted that he had to pay. I do not understand the hotel's policies re. this, especially when my husband was not given a room key and had not officially checked in. 2. Lack of space a. I wanted to leave a hand carry luggage at the hotel on 18-21 July and my request was turned down. I understand the lack of space at this hotel. On the contrary, I and my husband stayed at L'Hotel Island South and we were able to store our huge Samsonite luggage there on 23-31 July. L'Hotel was a tad far from the city area but the service and space provided there as compared to Sohotel made us regret that we booked Sohotel in the first place. b. The room at Sohotel was terribly small too. 3. My request for a high floor room was met so that was reasonably good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AgentIna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superiour double on one of the higher floors. The room was just like the images on their website, very clean and tidy with elegant design. Even though is was located very centrally, it was nice and quiet at night. We realised on the first day that our fridge didn't work and mentioned it to reception staff. The same afternoon our fridge was in working order including cold drinks in it. The service was very good and the staff were always very helpful with any enquiries we had. The hotel name might be misleading, as the hotel is not located in Soho, but in Sheung Wan. Soho is about a 10-15 minute walk away, though easy to walk there day and night. The only downfall was the internet. Even though the internet speed was alright, the internet was somewhat limited/restricted. Our mobile apps weren't able to update. They got stuck half way which made them unusable. The way we fixed this problem was to visit the Apple Store where internet was in normal working condition. Overall I'd definitely recommend this place as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: Great location-walkable from the shops of central, the ferries, the nightlife of the mid levels and yet you feel like you're in real hong kong-gd balance. Small room but gd compared to others we looked at. Tv, free wifi, great modern bathroom, excellent aircon, comfy bed, free water and a fridge. Staff were so friendly too and made it feel like home for 3 nights. Cafe next door gd for a westerner's breakfast but other authentic places all around the hotel. Would def return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Karinandsven
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the vibrant and exotic city of Hong Kong. This hotel is very good pick while staying in the city. The hotel is centrally located and very close to the ferries. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are spotless clean and modern. After the long trip we really enjoyed the good and hot showers.The rooms are a bit small, but that is typicall for Hong Kong. We also appreciated the free Wifi. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “So Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TherouxWannabe
Reviews.Content: You'll see in many of the reviews that the room are tiny, and indeed they are. But get over it: You're in Asia. The bed was comfortable, the Internet ports worked, the bathroom was top-notch nice, and the AC helped to stave off the ubiquitous HK humidity. I would definitely go back. Place was clean, modern, quiet, safe. There was a safe in the room, always a nice feature. The part of town it's in is tranquil bordering on boring at night, but I noticed a wine bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: thomasrmuc
Reviews.Content: a truely nice place! if you go on your own you can book the standard room if you are a couple take deluxe or studio. the standard rooms bed is app 1,20m wide. i would not know where to put 2 suitcases in that tiny room. another tip: bring adaptor! no plugs - even not for shavers- are provided!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Fluterphil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights as it was cheap. Room was about 6 by 8 feet so not much room for luggage and very little space to hang clothes up. Small shower room/toilet but worked well. Staff very good and helpful. I had bood breakfast inc but you have to pre order day before from a choice of sandwiches and tea/coffee or juice and a time for delivery! The sandwiches were OK but would have preferred to sit down to a normal breakfast. Not too far from MRT Station and all the other delights Hong Kong has to offer. I would stay again but would try to get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent if all you want to is sleep.”
Reviews.Author: linlaupeh
Reviews.Content: I took this room together with a friend for the recent Rugby 7s in Hong Kong. We thought that we could save a little money by sharing a room, fully expecting that it would be cramped. Upon entering the room it became immediately clear that 2 people who did not intend to have carnal relations could not share the twin room. My estimate was that it was about 9 x 8 ft, so be warned. Other than the size the hotel was pretty decent. The wi fi worked well, the rooms were clean and the service was staff were friendly enough. The hotel also provided breakfast and free drinking water which was a nice touch. Locationwise it was not great, there are amenities nearby and it is a 10 minute stroll to the underground but there's nothing near the hotel itself. The room itself is pretty basic with just a TV, hair dryer and safe. No water heater, dvd player, iphone docking etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: Steve1982uk
Reviews.Content: For the location (10-15 minutes' walk from Central, Soho, etc) this is not a bad place and I would stay again for that very reason. The rooms are on the small side, but this is frankly a fact of life in HK unless you are prepared to stay out of the way, or 2-3 times as much. The rooms are clean, well laid out and well designed and decorated. Very good service at the desk, free wifi, PCs in the lobby. My only gripes is the lack of kettle / tea / coffee in the rooms, and that the only English TV channel was CNBC!

Reviews.Title: “Just do it”
Reviews.Author: FrisHB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 as the hotel is near my son's apartment. I meant to review it at the time but obviously forgot to. We are off to HK again and did not hesitate to rebook this hotel. Last time we had a standard room for one night, but found it to be too small so we upgraded to a superior room. Well worth the extra $s. Breakfast was included last time but you can get breakfast in lots of nearby locations. It is close to the action and has easy access to Central.

Reviews.Title: “All promise and no delivery”
Reviews.Author: Nick000017
Reviews.Content: On the plus side great location and friendly staff. Other than that minute rooms very hard beds & pillows. No space to put suitcases no shelves or any space in bathroom and rubbish lighting. I would definitely not stay there again and would prefer to go a little further afield for a half decent size room with beds you can actually get some sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but very tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Ellemorena
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed here twice - like what other reviewers said, this is perfect for a city holiday where you want to enjoy the night life (walking distance to Soho and LKF area), and to central train station, etc. however the rooms are very, very tiny! We had a room with 2 single bed that was surprisingly very comfortable if not yummy to sleep in. We did have to carefully manuever ourselves around the room (2 tall girls with a lot of luggage) as we literally occupy every inch of the room with ourselves, our luggages and the bed. The upside though - the shower was excellent! We both agreed that the quality was that of a proper big hotel. We adored the little breakfast nook and the smoking area. The staff did have difficulty understanding the egg order - everyday they get our order wrong! Omelet came out fried, or that we order fried they served an omelet..it was exhausting to explain so we just ate what was served. it was funny in the end...it became a came to me and my friend ;-) If you are spending a couple of nights in HK for a shopping trip or weekend of partying - this place is your best bet. This hotel will now be my weekend hotel in HK. Value for money, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: dsl24
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the business district on Hong Kong Island, Sohotel is a good value with fairly small but clean well-appointed rooms and good service. An excellent cooked- to-order breakfast is included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and value for money but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: MacauGerard
Reviews.Content: Walked past this boutique hotel in Sheung Wan when on another trip in Hong Kong recently, and when I was forced to stay a night in Hong Kong when transiting recently, I remembered it and booked the Sohotel purely based on location. It is what it is...a really great location, convenient for shopping and going out in HK, good price for HK hotels and super friendly staff...but the room, whilst comfortable, clean and boasting a good hot shower is tiny..really, really tiny, as in 11sqm tiny...so if you are looking for a nice 20sqm room, this isn't the place for you. Perfect for a short shopping trip or if you are forced to stay in town for an overnight trip, but its essentially a box room with amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room, Excellent location and Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: awesome_world2010
Reviews.Content: The first impression when I arrived at the hotel's lobby was the jasmine scent which was a nice touch! The front desk staff were very friendly as well, so I had a good feeling about this hotel... and I was right. But there is only one thing about this hotel that may surprise you, the room is very small! However, this was no problem at all for me and my husband (he's almost 6 ft tall) as the room was very clean, this hotel has free WiFi, and the bathroom is good sized. And their jasmine scented shampoo and soaps were very nice as well. I've stayed 5 nights at this hotel at their standard room and I had good sleeps after exploring HK at the end of the day. I also liked the fact that this hotel is located about 5 min walk from Sheung Wan MTR station, and Sheung Wan is only 1 station away from Central station. Sheung Wan is also close to Macau Ferry terminal and it's close to the tram stops. There are also interesting bird nest shops outside the hotel, which is something that you do not see every day. Right outside the hotel, there are also 7-Eleven, K Circle shop, and Wellcome supermarket nearby. There are some nice eateries at Sheung Wan, otherwise you can walk about 10 minute to Wellington Street at Central to find popular HK eateries. The hotel stay also includes breakfast as well, which is good (as smaller hotels usually do not offer breakfast). Because of their small rooms, I do not really recommend stays for family or travellers who like to spend most of their day in the hotel (then again... HK has so much things to explore, why would you want to spend most of your days in the hotel anyway?). I will definitely stay at Sohotel again next time when we visit HK. I highly recommend this hotel for singles or couples travellers who like basic, nice, clean hotel at a good location who doesn't mind a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Good Honest staff..what more can you ask?”
Reviews.Author: robbyds
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend Sohotel to anybody staying in HK for a couple of days. The standard room are small but practical. Everything you need is there except for closet space. Rooms are clean, amenities are changed daily, breakfast is good, and the attendants and staff are very courteous, helpful and can speak in English. They are also very honest...we asked the front desk if we can secure tickets for a ferry ride to Macau and she told us that it would be cheaper to buy them at the terminal instead...also, I left my shopping bag full of H&M clothes when I checked out and the housekeeping rushed down to return them to me before I boarded my taxi. I definitely recommend Sohotel for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: alexander_1984_1984
Reviews.Content: Travelling alone for 2 nights. Booked a superior room. Room was clean, comfortable, quite small, barely room to get down the side of the double bed. Bathroom was also small, but clean and fittings well kept. Shower was huge considering the size of the bathroom which was nice. Bedrooms and bathrooms well layed out for the size. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Free Wifi, lots of tv channels (not that I watched it) and just a short walk to soho one of the main areas of Hong Kong. Conclusion - pleasant stay, nothing wrong with it for what I needed it for. Would have been squashed with two people on a long stay/more than one suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying, pleasant experience, shoebox room”
Reviews.Author: getlucky
Reviews.Content: This would be my second time staying in So-Hotel and I didn't realize that the first time around was for a Superior room. Got a standard room this time and it was small and squeezy, but not unexpected in HK for that price. Anyway I was there for business and used the hotel for its sleeping bed only. Quite a distance from the MTR no matter which exit you take. The vibrant and hectic life was quite pleasing to watch while having your cup of coffee from the coffee shop a couple stores away. Food is never a problem, be it Western (simple sandwich and pasta) to Chinese (ranging from traditional market food to expensive restaurants) are plentiful in the area. I made the mistake of taking the bus from the airport and had to drag 2 large luggages through the busy streets of Sheung Wan and I'd assume taxi fare from Central would be money well spent. Room is small, quite tricky to fit my 2 luggages. Bathroom is what I'd call efficient, has everything you need, nothing luxurious and as small or smaller than a closet storage. WIFI was a plus. Reception staff greeted me everytime I walked pass them which was a nice gesture in HK. Since it was a business trip, I left the hotel early and came back rather late and didn't mind the size of the room at all. If you are travelling in 2 or more, I'd suggest spending the extra dollar on a superior room for your own comfort. If you want spacey rooms, budget hotels in HK island should not be on your list. I'd come back for my next business trip, but definitely not for any other leisure/holiday purposes or worse still, romantic getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: Yes - the rooms are small, Yes there is no room to store/open more than one suitcase, yes the bathroom is small and there is limited "bench" space on the sink, but this is typical of smaller HK hotels. The price you pay stays true the size of the rooms and the hotel factilites - of which there is no pool, no restaurants or bar and and no there is no coffee/tea making facilites in the room- so you are paying for what you get. That being said -there is a pacific coffee around the corner and its 10 minute walk into soho or LKF for dinner/lunch and a few minutes to Sheung Wan MTR. Internet connection is room is fast and reliable, as i travel for business this is always a top priority. I would not reccomend this hotel if it was for vacation - but a short business trip of 2-3 nights - its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms - there are better hotels for less money”
Reviews.Author: luru
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - I've stayed in much worse places, but the Sohotel just isn't worth the money you pay for it! My room on the 16th floor was really tiny - even for Hong Kong standards. I've stayed in Hong Kong before, but those rooms were just too small for 2 people and 2 large suitcases. The bed was literally taking up 80% of the overall room, the sink was so small that every time I tried to wash my face half of the water ended up on the floor. Space for toiletries in the bathroom? Forget it - there is just no space to put anything, and even worse, there is no electric outlet in the bathroom so you have to dry your hair outside... Also, there is CONSTRUCTION work going on right next door (it is in a very early stage so this will probably bother hotel guest for at least 1 more year), so bring earplugs if you want to sleep during the day. The breakfast is very limited. There is no buffet, you will just get 1 single slice of toast, some pieces of melon and 1 item from a menu, I don't usually eat a lot, but this breakfast just didn't do it for me. On the positive side, the cleanness of the room was OK and the staff was also nice enough. One bad experience with the staff: We had to get to the airport at 5pm, apparently at this time there is a shift change for taxi drivers. The concierge/receptionist wasn't helpful at all. He suggested to take the metro instead...not optimal with a large suitcase. To summarize, there are better hotels with larger rooms available in Hong Kong for less money. I don't really see a reason to stay at the Sohotel unless you really need to be at that location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BoboBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sohotel for 5 nights. We had booked the standard room. On arrival we showed ourselves to the room and it was tiny. There was not enough room for 2 people to spend anytime in it together. I decided I couldn't stay in there as it felt claustrophobic. I went down to reception and asked if we could upgrade to a bigger room and paid extra for the suite. The suite was lovely compared to the first room with a separate seating area and a bath as well as a shower. Although we paid extra for the suite this room didn’t include breakfast so the first day we decided to pay for it. For our 700HKD we was served a few chunks of melon with toast and after we had eaten the toast we were served 2 fried eggs with coffee. For the price it was not worth it. The hotel was clean and tidy and the room attendants were really good. The location was perfect for what we wanted, the staff were courteous and helpful but when I go back to HK I will shop around a bit more in future and possibly find somewhere with some outside space.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night, not a week!”
Reviews.Author: cbanks86
Reviews.Content: Well Arrived and were not able to check in early but this will probably be down to the fact it was rugby 7s weekend and all the rooms were booked. Very modern and clean, but.... our room was tiny. Not great as we were staying for a week. No wardrobe so we were living out of 2 large suitcases that took up the remaining floor space. The walls are also very thin. We could tell what channel next door was watching. Worth paying extra for a better room or better hotel. Breakfast was ok, mainly noodles and broth, or eggs and sausages. Free wi-fi in the rooms is great. Make sure you take a card from the hotel as the taxis don't really know where it is as it is fairly new. The SoHotel is great as a base for a couple of days but not for a longer stay. There are some really nice little bars near the hotel - one called Tantra, very nice people and nice drinks. 2 min walk from subway which is great as that then connects you to the rest of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Winner”
Reviews.Author: junkemail669
Reviews.Content: Very smoky non-smoking hotel... Stayed for 2 nights and each night my room filled with second hand smoke and each night I called the front desk but I guess they could not stop it... Standard rooms are about 150 sq. feet or 13 sq. meters, which is small even by HK standards... When I arrived at night to check-in I had to stand in the lobby for 15 minutes waiting for the front desk staff to come back to the front desk - I guess he was on break... I was wet from the rain and got blasted by the lobby aircon... Not a great stay... Even at this price point there are better options near by... Try Traders, Island Pacific Hotel or YWCA... All better than SoHotel, which is not in SoHo by the way...

Reviews.Title: “Decent reasonably priced hotel in Central HK”
Reviews.Author: talk2mrjones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good. Having visited Hong Kong a number of times - I know hotels there are expensive with tiny rooms and the HK people are not renowned for being worlds' most cuddly. Once you've learned that then your expectations are realistic and you can rate HK hotels on their relative merits. We had Junior Suite and Superior Twin for our party. As expected in HK rooms were small but nicely decorated. Suite smelled a bit funny till you turned up the AC but that's not uncommon in HK either. Might be the cleaning fluids they use as the bathroom was certainly v clean with plenty of high pressure hot water that's always a nice plus for a hotel room. Location is very decent and getting taxis is very easy 24hrs. Majority of staff very nice and helpful especially guy on front desk who is super on-the-ball with weather forecasts. One shift of breakfast staff clueless/pedants but the other shift were simply lovely. There's an little outdoor smoking area on level 6 for those who need it. Overall a good choice of hotel for HK especially for the price in Central. I would stay at Sohotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A winner!”
Reviews.Author: 76dragon
Reviews.Content: For a female business traveller who pays out of her own pocket for hotels, this hotel is definitely a winner in so many aspects. I travel to Hk every other month and have stayed at numerous hotels and sohotel is the by the far the one I would highly recommend to anyone who likes the buzz of soho nearby and the convenience of the MTR without having to pay exorbitant price. Service at this hotel is well beyond their call of duty, I had a splitting headache & had asked for aspirin in which they did not have, the front desk then went on to say that they will get someone to run out to buy and will have them sent up to my room. True enough, I had the aspirin delivered to my room in the next 15 mins! The complimentary breakfast was simply delicious and the ladies at the cafe were so accommodating and it felt right at home with your mum actually serving you breakfast! The free wifi certainly helps and at no time was it down nor weak. The only con and this is well not within their control, is the construction right opposite. The drilling & hammering gets you up by 8am & if you had a late night previously, this may not be the best way to rise. I feedback this to them and guess what! I was given ear plugs when I returned later than evening, a fine example of top notch customer service. On my last trip 2 weeks ago, I tried to book Sohotel but they were full, it's not hard to know why they are full, with loyal customer like myself, you are definitely pampered at Sohotel!

Reviews.Title: “Find youself a better place- Rude staff, breakfast served unhygienically”
Reviews.Author: psaini09
Reviews.Content: Only thing that we liked about the hotel was its location, it was located at 5mins walk to Sheung wan station. From here it was easy to take a train to anywhere you want to go. About the hotel we booked a standard room but this is way too small, bed is attached to the two wall and there is literally 15inch of space left in-between, so you cant even open you luggage over there. We did upgrade to superior room which was bit bigger but still not enough to keep the luggage properly and with it you don't have enough space to move around. hotel staff was just OK, I don't remember the name as this skinny girl, use to work at reception almost every morning while we was there she had a bad attitude problem. On the day i left, I requested the staff to get a taxi and they just pointed me to the front entrance asking i can stop one over there. I had a suitcase and three bags but they wasn't helpful enough to help me with the luggage. Service guys literally dragged my luggage to and from the room. As i wasn't able to find a hotel which servers the breakfast and that was one of my deciding point to stay in this hotel but i can say they do serve very basic breakfast. They had a list of 10-12 items of which i tried few and they said its finished or not available so i end up eating egg sandwich for four days There is only one guys to serve everyone so you have to wait, i was twice served a juice in an unwashed glass with lipstick marks on it. I reported that to reception but they didn't like it and advised i should tell that to the staff serving. I end up paying them 700 Aussie dollars for 4nights, i should have booked a better hotel for this price. I can just advise find yourself a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value in good position”
Reviews.Author: lostpilgrim2010
Reviews.Content: 150 dollars a night for smallish room and breakfast.,good for hk clean helpful staff walk to anywhere you need to go

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: ML_GL
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk from the nearest metro station. Very close to trams and Macau ferry. The rooms are modern and well kept, but very small. The bathroom is well-designed (no wet floor after the shower!), but the frosted glass door won't suit everybody. Staff were always helpful. Breakfasts consisted of bacon and eggs or omelette, juice, coffee/tea, toast and jam and some fruit pieces. One downside at the moment is that there is construction work in a building opposite. Jackhammers started at about 8:30 and ran into the late afternoon. No problem if you are out and about, but painful if you are trying to catch up from lost sleep after a very long flight. Free Internet (wired) worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “It's All About Location & Expectation”
Reviews.Author: getlucky
Reviews.Content: Don't come to this hotel with a high expectation and you'll be pleasantly surprised as I was. The rooms were adequate (small but they all are in HK, and I was able to fit 2 big luggages in the room, so it was enough). It's a 7 mins walk from the nearest MTR exit. Breakfast was so so, but food is everywhere and they are not expensive. Reception was efficient and nice. During off peak seasons, the price gets really good for a business/leisure hotel. I'd come back to stay again due to the convenience & location.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LipTe
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a family run and very small but cosy. Be aware that the standard rooms are very small but modern and clean. the design of the hotel is very modern and the staff very friendly. Although they still need a little practise. WiFi was not working n our room despite the fact that they say they have it for free. (you can still use the 2 computers in the lobby) Breakfast was not so great. No buffet. Location was very good, The underground is reachable in about 5 min by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms are the smallest I've seen in Hong Kong - overpriced rooms, moody staff, holes in sheets”
Reviews.Author: TrustedOpinion
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are like tiny rooms on a ship - tiny. I dreaded returning to my room, but couldn't cancel my reservation because of their stiff penalty so I stayed for 5 nights. NO closet - just a rack with a few hangers. My two suitcases took up almost the whole room which was drab and lifeless. I had a bench removed which was supposed to be a desk chair (the desk was a piece of glass) to create a bit more room. I put one suitcase underneath the 'desk' and sat at the foot of the bed to use my computer on the desk...that's how tight it was. Reception staff uneven and moody - two people were nice, two were very grumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: supertraveler333
Reviews.Content: Compared to many other hotels I have stayed in in HK, this hotel had the best value by far. Being from NYC, space isn't an issue, so for us, so we were very happy with our small 300 sq ft, 900HKD room, which had great decor, was clean, and had large comfortable bathrooms (definite priorities!). The location is also quite ideal -- it is only a 10-15 minute walk from the main bar and restaurant district, and about 5 minutes from the Sheung Wan subway station. Most hotels in the area are much more expensive, since they are in a prime location of the city, so we were happily surprised to find such a reasonable gem. We liked it so much we came back again after returning from our travels in SE Asia!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: shivamwrites
Reviews.Content: Sohotel, close to the Sheung Wan MTR is a good value for money hotel. It provides good breakfast as well within the hotel rate. Though the rooms are small, but then they are small in most hotels in HK. The staff is friendly and warm.

Reviews.Title: “superb stay”
Reviews.Author: DayanaD
Reviews.Content: Two thumbs up for Sohotel...the price i paid worth the superb stay. I do agreed on "standard" compact room, well it is HK! Stayed for 4 nights. The room is super clean, super cozy for 700HK/nite. Srategic located; 5 minutes walk to Sheung Wan MRT station. 2 to 3 7-Eleven around the corner, mcD 24hr, International ( supermarket ). Easy to catch bus and taxi. Just a 10 minutes leisure walk through the "downtown" neighbourhood to The Central. Excellent service, friendly staffs. Love the breakfast! Most memorable moment when the frontdesk staffs helped me to carry my heavy stuffs to the bus stop on the last day. Definitely a hidden gem, worth every single cents.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel and were very happy with it. The included breakfast is outstanding, the beds are very sleep-able, loads of hot water. The entire hotel is very clean and everyone working there is very nice. Location is about 5 minutes from the metro, and about 2 minutes from the trolley bus. It's not central, but it works. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good size room for HK”
Reviews.Author: Cfan41
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a fair few places in Hong Kong and this might be my new favourite. If you want total luxury then there are plenty of options with the price tag attached and this place wont be for you. But if you like funky hotels that you sleep in, have helpful staff and are in great locations then this is the perfect place. From the airport take the E11 bus to Macau Ferry Terminal and thn walk 5min to the hotel (this is the cheapest way to get from the airport $HK40). Make sure you cheeck ut the Modern China Restaurant on Level 10 of Times Square in Causeway Bay, I think it is one of the very best restaurants in Hong Kong and my favourite for spicy food.

Reviews.Title: “Style”
Reviews.Author: Patrick K
Reviews.Content: Nestled away in Bonham Strand, SoHotel is a chic, albeit compact, hotel. From the moment, you enter the hotel, the conscious and deliberate focus is on providing a stylish and vogue experience. The lobby is a good refelction of what SoHotel has to offer - chiseled glass and perspex and soft lighting in. Rooms, as with almost all accommodation in Hong kong, are small. Beds are essentially accessible only from the end. But storage in rooms is well designed and the bath area is bigger than most - a huge shower with great water pressure. Conveniently located on the island side in Hong Kong, SoHotel has easy access to both the Dingding (light rail) and MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish contemporary hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DandLLondon
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this underrated lesser-known hotel. Rooms are very clean with nice contemporary design albeit on the compact side (we had a Deluxe double which seemed well worth the upgrade including decent LCD TV) but included a good size bathroom and shower. Considering how little time we spent in the room this was no problem at all and good value considering the lack of quality, well priced ‘boutique’ hotels in the city. Great location near Hollywood road and easy walking distance to the impressive restaurants and bars in Soho. Metro is a 7-10 minutes walk for easy access around all the key areas. Decent breakfast accommodating vegetarians and friendly, approachable staff. Overall good value for money – would definitely stay again, if you like slick and stylish contemporary hotels retaining the essence of Asian design this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl of Sheung Wan”
Reviews.Author: zarkhrov
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between tall buildings along the western stretch of Bonham Strand, it is easy to miss SoHotel if one was just walking by the establishment. With a cool, collected design for its entrance, this little pearl embedded in the Sheung Wan District of HK island sparkles in the night when all the surrounding abalone/seafood shops have shut their shutters. A 10-min walk from the Sheung Wan MTR station provides easy access from the airport, though a cheaper option would be to take the airport bus which stops a bus-stop about 15 minutes walk away. The tram-stops can be reached in 5 minutes with four 24-hr convenience shops and a few HK-style cafes around the area. Staff speak English very well (a surprise for hotels of this size) and the manager was very helpful, especially when my keycard could not open the room door on the second night, he went up to my room to confirm that the keycard was reset correctly. As the hotel was pretty new, all the furnishings in the Standard (semi-double) room were in good working condition (most hotel rooms in HK are small due to the exorbitant land prices). The bathroom/shower was spacious (in comparison to another hotel that I stayed in, I couldn't even bend down in that hotel's tiny shower!). With a small flat-screen TV and all-day free wi-fi or cabled internet access, this made my staying experience all the more pleasant. The breakfast was served in a breakfast room on the fourth floor (?), with a choice of Western breakfast (toast, eggs and ham) or Cantonese-style porridge. With no additional facilities, this hotel would be more suitable for first-time visitors to HK on a budget or simply independent (on business or pleasure) travelers who don't need the frills of a 5-star hotel.
